Ingest_LDD.name: Surface Mission Information
Ingest_LDD.comment:
## CHANGE LOG ## 1.0.0.0 - Initial version
1.1.0.0, CDC - Upgraded to v1B00 of the IM. - Re-classified this dictionary as a Discipline Dictionary, instead of Mission Dictionary. - Renamed Surface_Mission_Parameters to Surface_Mission_Information, Command_Execution_Information to Command_Execution, and Telemetry_Information to Telemetry.
1.1.1.0, CDC - Upgraded to v1D00 of the IM. - Fixed bugs in download_priority attribute: removed min and max value constraints, made definition more generic.
1.2.0.0, Trent Hare - Added Observational_Intent class and attributes: campaign, goal, task, activity_notes, keyword - Added command_dispatch_sclk to msn_surface:Command_Execution. Cardinality 0:1 - Added several telemetry attibutes for MSL/M2020 - Added Commanded_Parameters class with download_priority attribute - Update command_source_id definition per GitHub PDS4-LDD-Issue-Repo/issues/37 - Added boot_counter, rtt_version attributes to Command_Execution - Added activity_id, target_id attributes to Observational_Intent - Update to PDS IM 1E00 - Update sequence_execution_count to have a min=0 - Update telemetry_source_start_time to ASCII_Date_Time_DOY_UTC and formation_rule - Added Commanded_Parameters to Surface_Mission_Information
1.2.1.0, Trent Hare - Added "Team-generated Image" enumeration value under transport_protocol
1.2.2.0 T.Hare - Added telemetry_alternate_name

DD_Attribute.name: surface_gravity
DD_Attribute.definition: The surface_gravity attribute specifies the acceleration of gravity (magnitude, not direction).

DD_Attribute.name: sequence_id
DD_Attribute.definition: The sequence_id identifies the command sequence used to acquire this product.

DD_Attribute.name: sequence_version_id
DD_Attribute.definition: The sequence_version_id identifies which of potentially several versions of a sequence_id were used to acquire this product.

DD_Attribute.name: command_sequence_number
DD_Attribute.definition: The command_sequence_number attribute provides a numeric identifier for a sequence of commands sent to a spacecraft or instrument.

DD_Attribute.name: sequence_execution_count
DD_Attribute.definition: The sequence_execution_count specifies how many times this sequence has executed since the last reset of the flight computer.

DD_Attribute.name: observation_id
DD_Attribute.definition: The observation_id specifies a unique identifier for a scientific observation within a data set.

DD_Attribute.name: request_id
DD_Attribute.definition: The request_id is used to group related datasets together by science or engineering application or theme, such as frames in a mosaic.

DD_Attribute.name: command_source_id
DD_Attribute.definition: Specifies where the command that triggered acquisition of this data came from. This may be "GROUND" for ground commanding, or the name of a flight software module that initiated the request.

DD_Attribute.name: command_dispatch_sclk
DD_Attribute.definition: Specifies the spacecraft clock time at which the command execution was started.

DD_Attribute.name: boot_counter
DD_Attribute.definition: Counter indicating the number of times the spacecraft flight software has been booted. The intent is that this is a global counter that can uniquely identify the current FSW boot, so other counters that reset at boot time can be disambiguated.

DD_Attribute.name: rtt_version
DD_Attribute.definition: Identifies the version of the Round-Trip Tracking (RTT) system used to create metadata in this observation

DD_Attribute.name: application_id
DD_Attribute.definition: The application_id (often abbreviated APID) attribute identifies the process, or source, which created the data. This can include information such as an identification of the instrument which generated the telemetry stream, its operating mode at the time of data acquisition, and any onboard compression of the data.

DD_Attribute.name: application_subtype_id
DD_Attribute.definition: The application_subtype_id attribute provides further distinction (i.e., greater specificity) among application_id types.

DD_Attribute.name: application_name
DD_Attribute.definition: The application_name attribute provides the name associated with the source or process which created the data.

DD_Attribute.name: provider_id
DD_Attribute.definition: The provider_id attribute identifies the organization or subsystem that supplied the telemetry data product to the producer of the raw (EDR) PDS data product. This is typically (but not always) the organization responsible for reassembling packetized data into a single product. These may vary by mission so the permissible values should be set by the mission dictionaries.

DD_Attribute.name: flight_software_version_id
DD_Attribute.definition: The flight_software_version_id attribute identifies the version of the instrument flight software used to acquire the image.

DD_Attribute.name: telemetry_source_name
DD_Attribute.definition: The telemetry_source_name specifies the name source of the telemetry data described in the parent class.

DD_Attribute.name: telemetry_alternate_name
DD_Attribute.definition: The telemetry_alternate_name is similar to telemetry_source_name but specifies an alternate name that may be used to additionally identify the source of the telemetry data in the parent class.

DD_Attribute.name: transport_protocol
DD_Attribute.definition: The transport_protocol attribute specifies the protocol used in the creation of the telemetry data products by the subsystem which generates the telemetry stream.

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: A complete file of raw telemetry as delivered from the spacecraft to the ground.
Image delivered from instrument team with no indication of what the actual protocol was.

DD_Attribute.name: communication_session_id
DD_Attribute.definition: Identifies the communication session used to acquire this data.

DD_Attribute.name: telemetry_source_start_time
DD_Attribute.definition: The telemetry_source_start_time specifies the creation time of the source product from which this product was derived. It is the same as the telemetry_source_sclk_start converted to Spacecraft Event Time (SCET).

DD_Attribute.name: telemetry_source_sclk_start
DD_Attribute.definition: The telemetry_source_sclk_start attribute specifies the value of the spacecraft clock (in seconds) at the creation time of the source product from which this product was derived.

DD_Attribute.name: product_completion_status
DD_Attribute.definition: The product_completion_status attribute indicates whether or not a product is complete or is in one of a number of incomplete states. Sample values might indicate that all portions of the product have been downlinked and received correctly, that all portions have not yet been received, or that the product contains transmission errors. The specific values are mission-dependent.

DD_Attribute.name: earth_received_start_date_time
DD_Attribute.definition: The earth_received_start_date_time attribute provides the earliest time at which any component telemetry data for a particular product was received.

DD_Attribute.name: earth_received_stop_date_time
DD_Attribute.definition: The earth_received_stop_date_time attribute provides the latest time at which any component telemetry data for a particular product was received.

DD_Attribute.name: download_priority
DD_Attribute.definition: The download_priority attribute specifies which data to downlink/transmit, based on order of importance. The ranking and meaning of specific values will vary depending on the mission, and should be defined in the mission software interface specification (SIS).

DD_Attribute.name: data_size
DD_Attribute.definition: The data_size specifies number of bytes in the compressed data stream, not including headers.

DD_Attribute.name: expected_packets
DD_Attribute.definition: The expected_packets attribute provides the total number of telemetry packets which constitute a complete data product, i.e., a data product without missing data.

DD_Attribute.name: received_packets
DD_Attribute.definition: The received_packets attribute provides the total number of telemetry packets actually used to construct this data product. cf. expected_packets.

DD_Attribute.name: telemetry_source_host_name
DD_Attribute.definition: Specifies the name of the host venue that provided the telemetry source data used in the creation of this data set.

DD_Attribute.name: expected_transmission_path
DD_Attribute.definition: Specifies the planned transmission path (route) for the telemetry data. See also transmission_path and communication_session_id.

DD_Attribute.name: transmission_path
DD_Attribute.definition: Indicates the actual transmission path (route) for the telemetry data. See also expected_transmission_path and communication_session_id.

DD_Attribute.name: flight_software_mode
DD_Attribute.definition: Specifies the active flight software mode at the time of data product creation. Interpretation of specific modes is mission-dependent.

DD_Attribute.name: telemetry_source_size
DD_Attribute.definition: Specifies the length in bytes of the telemetry stream from which this product was derived.

DD_Attribute.name: telemetry_source_checksum
DD_Attribute.definition: Specifies the checksum for the telemetry stream from which this product was derived.

DD_Attribute.name: auto_delete_flag
DD_Attribute.definition: Indicates if the product was to be automatically deleted onboard after it is transmitted.

DD_Attribute.name: virtual_channel_id
DD_Attribute.definition: Specifies the type of data flowing in the telemetry virtual channel.

DD_Attribute.name: campaign
DD_Attribute.definition: Identifies the long-term observational campaign of which this observation is a part.

DD_Attribute.name: goal
DD_Attribute.definition: Identifies the goal of this observation.

DD_Attribute.name: task
DD_Attribute.definition: Identifies the specific task for this observation.

DD_Attribute.name: activity_notes
DD_Attribute.definition: Provides additional notes regarding the activity.

DD_Attribute.name: keyword
DD_Attribute.definition: Identifies geological characteristics of a feature or target.

DD_Attribute.name: activity_id
DD_Attribute.definition: Identifier specifying the activity this observation is a part of.

DD_Attribute.name: target_id
DD_Attribute.definition: Identifier specifying the name or identifier of the primary target this observation is observing. This is distinct from the pds:Target class in that pds:Target typically refers to a large entity such as a planet or satellite, whereas this keyword is intended to capture much finer target information, for example a rock name or even a specific location on a rock.

DD_Class.name: Surface_Mission_Information
DD_Class.definition: The Surface_Mission_Information class contains attributes specific to surface missions which apply across instrument types.

DD_Class.name: Command_Execution
DD_Class.definition: The Command_Execution class contains information about how the command that acquired this data was executed, such as sequence or activity.

DD_Class.name: Commanded_Parameters
DD_Class.definition: The Commanded_Parameters class contains attributes used to identify or describe the commands sent to a spacecraft to perform one or more actions resulting in the acquisition of the current data product. These are distinct from similar values in the root Surface_Mission_Information class which indicate the state of the data as acquired.

DD_Class.name: Telemetry
DD_Class.definition: The Telemetry class contains downlink-related attributes used primarily during mission operations.

DD_Class.name: Observational_Intent
DD_Class.definition: Describes the intent and context of the observation.
